body:
I am installing a few packages. cmake is pulled in as dependency. No cmake version is specified explicitly, although some package specify cmake version constraints.

Spack decides to install `cmake @3.4.3`. This version number does not appear anywhere. However, it is the version number given in cmake's `url` string.

This looks like a bug. Spack should choose the most modern cmake version here, which is `cmake @3.6.0`.
title: Spack prefers cmake@3.4.3 instead of the newest version
